page.title: 11West Stour-The Ship Inn
page.content: Domesday Book mentions two settlements West Stour and Little Kington.The latter remained a small hamlet but the other developed into a village with open fields to the south-west,enclosed in 1779.One of Manor Farm barns is dated 1793 while the Ship Inn next door has its first recorded innkeeper in 1714.It was a coaching inn where horses were changed for the pull up to Shaftesbury.As coaches and carts gave way to cars and charabancs,the inn keeper replaced the stables with a garage and petrol pump.Here the coach waited for excited children for the Sunday School outing to Weymouth,and here too present day children board their buses for primary and secondary schools.In due course a postbox was built into a stone pillar there and in 1963 a telephone box appeared.
